detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Delivery Mode -This is an in-person course. Students are expected to meet in-person on the days and times listed. All courses labelled as ‘in-person’ are fully in-person for the entire term, including exams, and require in-person attendance to complete.

Waitlist Policy -All waitlists will follow a first come, first serve policy, unless specified otherwise. Once a course is full, its status will be changed to “Waitlist” and students who register will be automatically added to the waitlist.

instances.text: RADS_V 301-001 - Exploring Imaging in the Twenty-First Century
RMST_V 301-101 - Prose Fiction and Non-Fiction of the Romance World

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Examine how the individual and society can be (mis)aligned with each other by visiting the children’s tale of Pinocchio and other Romance classics.  
RMST 301 is one of the program requirements for RMST Minor, Major and Honours. 

See the full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/rmst301/  

Language of Instruction: English 

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

instances.text: RMST_V 305-101 - Introduction to Romance Language Cinema

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Overview of the history, aesthetics and characteristics of films in French, Italian, Spanish, and/or Portuguese. 
See the full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/rmst305/    

Language of Instruction: English 

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

instances.text: RMST_V 345-101 - Italian Fascism in Interdisciplinary Perspective

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Types and Archetypes of Fascism in the Age of the Crisis of Liberal Democracy. Gain foundational knowledge about the phenomenon of fascism as it arose and ran its course in the context of neo-Latin societies and cultures.  
ITAL 345 and RMST 345 are taught in the same classroom at the same time by the same instructor. All students must register in RMST 345.  Both courses fulfill the literature requirement for the Faculty of Arts. 

See the full course overview: https://fhis.ubc.ca/course-description/ital345   

Language of Instruction: English 

Contact us here: https://fhis.ubc.ca/undergraduate-advising-contact-form/

Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
